#DataViz #accessibility

I started playing with a new (to me) series of tooltip interactions in a hex map in my latest story for USAFacts.

You can trigger the tooltip on big screens by hovering with your mouse or accessing the map with your "TAB" key and then using arrow keys to navigate individual states.

On small screens, hitboxes are small, so I opted to trigger tooltips via a slider which lists states in alphabetical order.

Curious what #dataviz and #a11y folks may think!

Check it out: https://usafacts.org/data-projects/disability-benefit-wait-time

Acccording to Wikipedia, U(n)/O(n) is the 'Lagrangian Grassmannian':

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagrangian_Grassmannian

This means that we can identify it with the space of all real subspaces L ⊆ ℂⁿ that are 'Lagrangian': they have real dimension n and

Im <v,w> = 0

for all v,w ∈ L.

Why is this true? I know there's a short explanation, but I haven't been able to figure it out! 🤔

(6/n, n = 6)

title: Exclusive: OpenAI Used Kenyan Workers on Less Than $2 Per Hour to Make ChatGPT Less Toxic

last_post.content:
ChatGPT gets treated like technological magic, but that ignores the humans behind the curtain that make it function.

OpenAI paid Sama to hire Kenyan workers at $1.32 to $2 an hour to review “child sexual abuse, bestiality, murder, suicide, torture, self harm, and incest” content. Their work made the tool less toxic, but left them mentally scarred. The company ended the contract when they found out TIME was digging into their practices.

https://time.com/6247678/openai-chatgpt-kenya-workers/

If you know the symplectic group you'll see how I cleverly sidestepped its usual definition, which involves the concept of 'symplectic structure'. title: Impact of the Euro 2020 championship on the spread of COVID-19 - Nature Communications

last_post.content:
How strongly did the EM 2020 (taking place summer 2021)
increase the spread of COVID?

We inferred this based on good data, including gender information.
The gender imbalance at gatherings in the context of football allowed us to narrow down the number of primary infections happening at the gatherings, and estimate the impact of the subsequent additional infection chains.

title: Single-use coffee pods have surprising environmental benefits over other brewing methods

last_post.content:
This is the "bitter lesson" of environmentalism, that the aesthetically repellent systems that are optimized for industrial efficiency usually have less impact, because industrial efficiency is close enough to "use less stuff" that they're usually aligned.

Manufacturing a plastic shell that goes in the landfill ends up worth it if you get more coffee out of fewer beans.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-solutions/2023/01/18/coffee-pods-sustainability-environmental-impact/

title: Websites Selling Abortion Pills Are Sharing Sensitive Data With Google

last_post.content:
ProPublica used Blacklight (https://themarkup.org/blacklight) to show that nine online abortion pill providers are sharing sensitive data with Google: https://www.propublica.org/article/websites-selling-abortion-pills-share-sensitive-data-with-google

title: A plane defect in the 3d O$(N)$ model

last_post.content: Today's #arXivsummary: https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.05728 by Krishnan & Metlitski. Authors extend the idea of an "extraordinary-log" boundary universality class to the 3D O(N) model in infinite geometry with a plane defect. Extraordinary-log universality class is present for any finite N≥2; evidence that, at N=Nc, the extraordinary and special fixed points annihilate and only the ordinary fixed point is left for N>N. #CondMat #StrEl #arXiv_2301_05728
